page.title: 14Coombe valley nature trail
page.content: The{Coombe Valley Nature Trail}was first established in 1970 by the Cornwall Naturalist Trust. It lies within the bounds of Stowe woods, a Forestry Commission woodland,which has both deciduous trees and conifers.The valley is part of the parish boundary between Morwenstow and Kilkhampton and has a small stream which rises near Kilkhampton flowing through it to Duckpool and the sea. The trail is made up of 4 trails which vary from walks along steep paths in new conifer plantations to gentle level sections with established hardwood and conifers either side. The valley supports a wide range of wild life and plants. With care a wide range of species can be seen such as badgers, grey squirrels, hedgehogs, brimstone, peacock, red admiral, finches, woodpeckers, jay, kestrel.
